headline: Live Nation signals record 2026 as global demand surges
summary: Investing.com -- Live Nation Entertainment Inc (NYSE:LYV) shares rose 2% in after-hours trading Thursday following a fourth-quarter revenue report that cleared market expectations. The concert giant posted $6.31 billion in quarterly revenue, surpassing the consensus analyst estimate of $6.13 billion. The company concluded 2025 with $25.2 billion in annual revenue, representing a 9% increase over the previous fiscal year. Operating income saw a substantial leap of 52% to $1.3 billion, driven by r

headline: Live Nation (LYV) Reports Q4 Loss, Beats Revenue Estimates
summary: Live Nation (LYV) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +2.20% and +3.97%, respectively, for the quarter ended December 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Live Nation Sales Rise on Concert Demand
summary: The live entertainment ticket provider said sales from concerts gained 12%, to $5.15 billion. Ticketing sales were up 1% and sponsorship and advertising sales increased 17%.

headline: Walmart earnings, Fed comments, jobs data: What to Watch
summary: Market Domination Overtime Host Josh Lipton previews several of the biggest stories to come tomorrow, Thursday, February 19, including earnings results from Walmart (WMT), Opendoor Technologies (OPEN), and Deere & Company (DE); commentary from Federal Reserve Vice Chair for Supervision Michelle Bowman and Minneapolis Fed President Neel Kashkari; and the weekly reading on initial jobless claims. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.
